intro: Cansjera malabarica, commonly known as the Malabar thornapple, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Solanaceae, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its hairy stems and lobed leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in summer, followed by spherical, greenish fruits that turn red when mature. It is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to withstand periods of drought. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
